benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/block - Block an account

covered: Valid payload creation with 201 for multiple scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC15, TC16, TC17, TC18, TC19, TC20, TC21, TC24, TC25, TC26, TC27) including edge cases and long/payload variations
Header validation and required metadata (TC08, TC11, TC09, TC10, TC07)
Error handling and status mappings (201 for success, 400 for malformed requests, 404 for non-existent accounts, 401 for missing auth, 503 for system/plugin/service issues)
Security considerations (TC13 SQL injection, TC14 malicious payload)
Regression tests (TC23 duplicate blocking state, TC24 backward compatibility)
Performance/scale-related tests (TC25 concurrency, TC26 resource utilization, TC27 accessibility)
Integration tests for plugin interactions (TC21, TC22)
gaps: Rate limiting tests not present: no scenarios validating throttling or flood control for rapid consecutive requests
Caching behavior not tested: no validation of caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) or responses for repeated identical requests
Pagination is not applicable to POST creating BlockingState entries in this API; explicit confirmation in guidelines would be helpful, but no pagination tests are necessary for this endpoint
Explicit 403/forbidden authorization scenarios not covered: some tests cover 401, but scenarios where user is authenticated but not authorized to block (403) are not shown
Validation of duplicate submission handling beyond existing regression (TC23) could be expanded to ensure idempotency in repeated requests
Edge-case validation of extremely large or malformed payloads beyond those already covered (e.g., extremely large BlockingState arrays beyond TC20) could be strengthened
recommendations: Add rate-limiting/throttling test scenarios to verify system behavior under bursty traffic (e.g., multiple concurrent POST /block calls in short time)
Add tests for caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) where applicable to POST responses
Include explicit 403 Forbidden scenarios to cover authenticated-but-not-authorized access attempts
Enhance idempotency tests for duplicate submissions to confirm consistent behavior across repeated requests
Extend large-payload and boundary-case payload testing to push limits beyond current TC16/TC20 coverage, ensuring proper handling under extreme conditions
